TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SoundPool extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The SoundPool class manages and plays audio resources for applications.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public SoundPool (int maxStreams, Android.Media.Stream streamType, int srcQuality);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 maxStreams, valuetype Android.Media.Stream streamType, int32 srcQuality) cil managed
new Android.Media.SoundPool : int * Android.Media.Stream * int -> Android.Media.SoundPool

Docs.param: the maximum number of simultaneous streams for this SoundPool object
the audio stream type as described in AudioManager For example, game applications will normally use AudioManager#STREAM_MUSIC.
the sample-rate converter quality. Currently has no effect. Use 0 for the default.
Docs.returns: a SoundPool object, or null if creation failed

Docs.param: the priority of the sound. Currently has no effect. Use a value of 1 for future compatibility.

Docs.returns: a sound ID. This value can be used to play or unload the sound.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Play (int soundID, float leftVolume, float rightVolume, int priority, int loop, float rate);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 Play(int32 soundID, float32 leftVolume, float32 rightVolume, int32 priority, int32 loop, float32 rate) cil managed
member this.Play : int * single * single * int * int * single -> int
MemberSignature.Usage: soundPool.Play (soundID, leftVolume, rightVolume, priority, loop, rate)

Docs.param: a soundID returned by the load() function
loop mode (0 = no loop, -1 = loop forever)
playback rate (1.0 = normal playback, range 0.5 to 2.0)
Docs.summary: Play a sound from a sound ID.
Docs.returns: non-zero streamID if successful, zero if failed
